Questions.Question: According to the lesson, what is the core idea of Hexagonal Architecture in one sentence?
Options: Your application should have exactly six ports
Your business logic should not know or care about the outside world
Your database should be at the center of the application
Your HTTP handlers should contain all the business rules
Questions.Explanation: The lesson states: 'Your business logic should not know or care about the outside world.' This is the fundamental principle from which everything else flows.

Questions.Question: According to the timeline diagram, what typically happens to a project at Month 12 with traditional architecture?
Options: Tests slow down and database coupling appears
Framework migration needed and everything breaks
Team frustration and technical debt explosion
Questions.Explanation: The timeline diagram shows that at Month 12: 'Framework migration needed' and 'Everything breaks'. This illustrates the pain of tightly-coupled architecture.

Questions.Question: What are the three core parts of Hexagonal Architecture shown in the hexagon diagram?
Options: Domain Core, Driving Adapters, Driven Adapters
Questions.Explanation: The hexagon diagram shows the Domain Core (green) at the center, with Driving Adapters (blue) on one side and Driven Adapters (purple) on the other.
